headline: Chipmakers Post Longest Win Streak Since 2017 Amid AI Growth
summary: The Philadelphia Stock Exchange Semiconductor Index rose 0.3% in its ninth straight positive session, its longest such streak since 2017.  Among notable movers, ON Semiconductor Corp. jumped 3%, Intel Corp. rose 2% and Applied Materials Inc. added 1.5%.  Broadcom Inc. sank 1.1% but is still up 55% in 2025.

headline: The AI Trade Has Stocks Near Highs Again. Some Tech Names Remain on the Sidelines
summary: This latest iteration of the AI hype train features massive rallies in stocks like  Oracle  and  Broadcom  Both surged after reporting quarterly results that specifically spelled out how artificial intelligence will drive sales and profit in the coming quarters.  While there could be some credence to that argument—particularly considering that an OpenAI investment helped boost Oracle—the market’s distinction between winners and losers during second-quarter earnings season has taken on a new dynamic.  Strategists at Goldman Sachs recently highlighted this trend in a note to clients.

headline: Cybersecurity firm Netskope lifts IPO price range, eyes $7.3 billion valuation
summary: Netskope's offering marks the second notable cybersecurity IPO of 2025 in New York after Thoma Bravo-backed SailPoint listed its shares in February and comes at a time when stricter data privacy regulations and the rise of AI-driven threats act as tailwinds for the secure access service edge (SASE) market.  The new targeted valuation puts Netskope closer to the $7.5 billion it commanded in a 2021 funding round led by investment firm ICONIQ.

headline: How the Narrative Around Broadcom’s AI Leadership Is Shaping Its Valuation Outlook
summary: Broadcom's stock price target saw only a minor upward revision, moving from $360.20 to $366.50 despite several optimistic signals from the company’s latest performance. Analysts highlighted Broadcom’s momentum in AI custom silicon, ongoing revenue strength from core segments, and renewed leadership stability as key factors driving the consensus. Stay tuned to discover how you can stay ahead of future narrative shifts surrounding Broadcom’s evolving outlook. What Wall Street Has Been...
